question: A 2 kg ball is rolling at a velocity of 5 m/s when it is struck by a bat, applying an impulse of 20 N⋅s in the opposite direction. What is the final velocity of the ball after the collision?
solution: The change in momentum is equal to the impulse: Δp = F⋅Δt. The initial momentum is p_i = mv_i = (2 kg)(5 m/s) = 10 kg⋅m/s. The change in momentum is Δp = 20 N⋅s in the opposite direction, so Δp = -20 kg⋅m/s. The final momentum is p_f = p_i + Δp = 10 kg⋅m/s - 20 kg⋅m/s = -10 kg⋅m/s. To find the final velocity, use the formula p = mv. Rearranging, we get v_f = p_f / m = (-10 kg⋅m/s) / (2 kg) = -5 m/s.
